title: Key Points for Revising the Guangdong Embroidery of Carp and Lotus
content:
I. Design Modifications:  
1. The veins of the lotus leaf need to be clearer to enhance the three-dimensional effect.  
2. Use gold and silver threads to transition the reflective areas of the fish scales to increase shine.  

II. Color Suggestions (Teacher Wu):  
1. The gradient from dark green to light green on the lotus leaf should be natural.  
2. Mix pink and white silk threads for the lotus petals to create a sense of depth.  

III. Next Steps:  
1. Complete the line drawing based on the sketch.  
2. Purchase the required silk thread colors.
summarized_info:
Yu Xiaowei documented the revision points for the Cantonese embroidery of the "Carp and Lotus" design. The content includes:  
I. Design Modifications:  
1. The veins of the lotus leaves need to be clearer to enhance the three-dimensional effect.  
2. Use gold and silver threads for the reflective parts of the fish scales to increase luster.  

II. Color Suggestions (Teacher Wu):  
1. The gradient from dark green to light green on the lotus leaves should appear natural.  
2. Use a mix of pink and white silk threads for the lotus petals to create a layered effect.  

III. Next Steps:  
1. Complete the line drawing based on the sketch.  
2. Purchase the required silk thread colors.

title: Key Points of the Gold Thread Embroidery Technique in Yue Embroidery
summarized_info:
Yu Xiaowei documented the key points of the Guangdong embroidery gold thread winding technique. The content includes:  

I. Core Techniques:  
1. The gold thread must remain flat and smooth, avoiding twists.  
2. Stitches should be tight and even to reflect the metallic luster.  

II. Applicable Scenarios:  
1. Often used for outlining contours, such as the trunk of a kapok tree.  
2. Suitable for depicting ornate and solemn patterns.  

III. Precautions:  
1. Before embroidering, apply a small amount of paste to the back of the fabric to secure it.  
2. When finishing a stitch, hide the thread end within the stitches on the back.

title: Recent Updates and Arrangements
content: Since the evening of February 17th, the rhythm of life has been completely disrupted. My mother suddenly suffered a stroke and was hospitalized, with her condition being critical at one point. Starting from the 18th, I have had to travel back and forth to the hospital every day, handling various procedures, providing care, and communicating with doctors. My time and energy have been almost entirely consumed. The half marathon I had planned to participate in April has had its training schedule suspended starting this week (the third week of February). Both physically and mentally, I am too exhausted to even think about running. I will consider what comes next once my mother's condition stabilizes.
summarized_info: It recorded that after my mother was hospitalized due to a stroke, the half-marathon training plan was suspended from late February due to the need to invest a significant amount of time in caregiving.

title: Reflections on Family Financial Planning for March
content: Today, I finally completed the setup for a regular investment plan in a global healthcare stock fund. This decision was made after careful consideration: 1. My mother’s health condition has made me deeply aware of the importance of health risk management and financial reserves; 2. As an insurance agent, I encounter numerous health protection cases in my daily work, and I believe the healthcare industry has long-term, stable demand and growth potential. This investment is not aimed at short-term windfalls but rather at building a long-term, growth-linked financial reserve for future health-related expenses (such as medical treatment and rehabilitation) for my family. The regular investment approach also helps smooth out risks, aligning with our family’s prudent financial style.
summarized_info: I have documented the reasons for choosing a global healthcare fund as a regular investment target, including concerns arising from my mother's health condition, my own professional awareness, and the purpose of preparing for future family health expenses.

title: Exercise Plan Adjustment (After Doctor's Recommendation)
content:
After consulting with Dr. Zhou on January 10th, I have redesigned my training plan. The core focus is to balance muscle strength and joint protection in preparation for the half marathon in April.

New plan (starting next week):
- Running: 3 times per week (long-distance, tempo runs, easy runs).
- Swimming: 2 times per week (active recovery, focusing on freestyle).
- **Yoga: 2 times per week** (emphasizing leg stretches, core strength, and stability exercises for the knee muscles, such as glute bridges and clam shells).

Daily monitoring of knee sensations is required, with minor adjustments made every two weeks based on feedback.

title: Lecture Drill Reflection 20251023
content: Practicing at home in the evening, rehearsing in front of the mirror. A major issue was discovered: unstable control of speaking pace, noticeably faster than usual, appearing very nervous. This is the biggest hidden risk, potentially causing difficulty for the audience to understand or even losing their interest. A deeper concern lies in the interactive segment; if the earlier part is rushed, the interaction may likely fall flat. Solutions: 1. Must arrive at the community center first thing tomorrow morning to thoroughly test the microphone, projector, and other equipment, eliminating worries about technical malfunctions. 2. Conduct at least three complete rehearsals on-site, focusing on deliberately slowing down the speaking pace and envisioning several interactive Q&A scenarios. The anxiety stems from insufficient preparation, which must be compensated for through additional actions.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei recorded reflections on the lecture rehearsal that evening, providing a detailed analysis of issues such as speaking too quickly and concerns about poor audience interaction. She also developed a specific plan for the following day, which included testing equipment in advance and intensifying rehearsal efforts.

title: Fitness Choice Record
content:
Today I visited the community fitness center near my home and decided to sign up for a three-month membership.  

Considerations:  
1. Location: It is very close to home, within walking distance, making it convenient to maintain consistency.  
2. Facilities: It features both an indoor heated swimming pool and a separate strength training area, meeting my diverse needs for rehabilitation training in terms of space and equipment.  
3. Environment and Services: Compared to other centers I’ve visited, this one is cleaner, and the manager is professional. The membership package includes two free monthly fitness assessments and rehabilitation guidance, which aligns perfectly with my goal of "systematic rehabilitation."  

In summary, this is the most suitable place for me to start and stick with a systematic rehabilitation training program.
summarized_info: I documented the reasons for choosing the community fitness center and becoming a member, mainly considering its proximity to home, availability of a swimming pool and strength training area, professional environment, and suitability for systematic rehabilitation training.

title: Cantonese Embroidery Creation Records and Reflections
content: On October 24th, during my commute, I sent the second draft of the design—which combines modern geometric color blocks with the traditional symbolism of the phoenix and carp—to my teacher for feedback. The teacher responded with a voice message, affirming the direction of "simplifying the form while preserving the essence," and specifically emphasized the importance of handling the silk-like luster in the phoenix's eye area, noting that this is key to "refining the details." title: Record of Creative Exchange with Meiling
content:
I had a long conversation with Meiling on the 17th. She was very supportive of my idea for "lifestyle Cantonese embroidery." From a product design perspective, she offered very specific suggestions:
1. Don’t just create a single pattern; instead, develop a series, such as a "Lingnan Fruits" series featuring lychee, longan, wampee, and star fruit.
2. The style must be simple and modern, aligning with the aesthetic preferences of young people, and should avoid being overly traditional or intricate.
This advice was truly eye-opening for me. I realized that my approach needs to shift from a personal hobby to marketable product design. We agreed to each start by gathering inspiration images.
summarized_info: I have noted the key points from my conversation with fellow embroidery enthusiast He Meiling. She suggested that I develop my ideas into a "Lingnan Delicacies" series and adopt a minimalist modern style, which has prompted me to shift my thinking toward serialized product design.

title: Considerations on Market Feasibility
content:
Organized based on Meiling's suggestion from the 22nd:  
Target audience: Young people who appreciate cultural and creative products and value life aesthetics, as well as tourists.  
Carrier options: Phone cases (high demand but competitive), small bookmarks (low cost, easy to produce, can serve as an entry point for a series), tea mats/coasters (high practicality, offering some display space).  
Cost control: Fabric selection, embroidery thread usage, and optimization of labor hours.  
Promotion channels: Consider online handmade platforms, markets, and collaborations with local cultural and creative spaces.  
Her analysis has transformed this idea from a mere hobby into a potential small venture. The first step needs to be carefully planned.
summarized_info: I have compiled the suggestions provided by He Meiling from a market perspective, including target audience analysis, media selection, cost control, and promotion channels. These have advanced my concept toward a "possible small venture."

title: Cantonese Embroidery Creation - Key Guidance Points from Teacher Wu
content:
October 24, 2025, Record of Communication with Teacher Wu Xiuying on Feedback for the 'Kapok Tree Project' Sketch:  
1. Line Guidance: Teacher Wu pointed out that the flow of the main trunk lines could be more coherent, suggesting referencing the "bone method brushwork" in traditional flower-and-bird paintings and slowing down the stitch transitions at turning points.  
2. Pattern Integration: The idea of abstracting family silhouettes was acknowledged, but a reminder was given to strengthen the symbolic connection between "kapok" (heroism/vitality) and "family" (reunion/shelter), which could be subtly hinted at through the treatment of light and shadow in the tree canopy.  
3. Key Technique: Emphasis was again placed on "local refinement," recommending the use of gold thread embroidery to accentuate details at the junctions between treetop flowers and character outlines, adding vitality through intricate work.  
—The modifications should integrate previous discussions on traditional patterns and be completed by this weekend.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei recorded the specific modification guidance given by Cantonese embroidery teacher Wu Xiuying on the sketch of the "Kapok Tree Project" (i.e., the design drawing of "Family and Kapok Tree").

title: The First Step in Investing and Long-Term Planning
content:
2025.06.10  
Today, I took the first step! I manually purchased 1,000 HKD worth of the XX Asia Biotech Fund as seed capital. After consulting with my advisor, I decided to launch the "Education Fund Reserve Plan" and officially include this healthcare-themed fund in my monthly automatic investment plan. I hope to leverage the power of long-term compound interest to add an extra layer of security for my family's future, particularly in education and healthcare.  

Next Steps:  
1. Automatic investment deductions will occur on the 10th of each month.  
2. I will simply review the net asset value report once at the end of each month to avoid frequent operations that could affect my mindset.  
3. I will maintain communication with my financial advisor and periodically review the overall asset allocation.
summarized_info: In my notes, I recorded that yesterday (June 10th), I made my first manual purchase and initiated an automatic investment plan named the 'Education Fund Reserve Plan.' The investment target is the XX Asia Biotech Fund, and it is positioned as a long-term investment to support future education and healthcare.

title: Nursing Record on the Morning of February 18

At 05:45, the nurses changed shifts and reported stable vital signs overnight. I moistened her lips and wiped her face. My own body felt stiff, with aches in my back and waist, and I was so exhausted that I could fall asleep even while sitting. Waiting for the doctor’s rounds.

title: Evening Record for February 18, 2025
content: Arriving home, I hugged Xuanxuan and Xinxin. Weiming reheated the leftovers, but I had no appetite and forced myself to eat a few bites. I checked Xuanxuan's homework and found many mistakes; my patience was wearing thin. I spent ten minutes reading "The Runaway Bunny" to Xinxin, and she listened with great delight. After urging both children to brush their teeth and wash their faces, I quickly took a shower. As the water poured down, I nearly fell asleep standing up. My spirit felt like a string stretched to its limit, and I wondered how much longer I could hold on.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei documented the process of interacting with her child, having dinner, checking homework, reading picture books, and washing up after arriving home in the evening. Between the lines, it reveals an extreme sense of exhaustion and a state of mental near-collapse.

title: Final Version of RSU Processing Solution
content:
After a three-party video discussion with Ah Hui and Xiao Feng, my RSU processing strategy has been finalized as follows:  
1. Core Principle: Adopting Xiao Feng’s key suggestion from yesterday, implement "vest in batches, sell in batches."  
2. Timing Selection: When selling, actively avoid the window around the company's financial report releases to reduce uncertainty.  
3. Fund Arrangement: Part of the proceeds from the sale will be remitted to Hong Kong through compliant channels, while the remainder can be temporarily placed in stable money market funds.  
4. Follow-up: Ah Hui will assist in handling cross-border compliance details.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei documented the RSU financial handling strategy finalized after discussions with family and friends, clarifying the approach of selling in batches, avoiding earnings report periods, and the fund allocation plan.

title: Morning Musings
content: After dropping off my daughter, I sat for a while on a bench in the park near home. The weather was lovely today, with sunlight filtering through the leaves. My mind kept wandering to the invitation from my alma mater. Regarding the ‘starting point,’ perhaps I could begin with that window seat in the library? The ‘turning point’ must be that late-night conversation. ‘Climbing’ and ‘lows’ are intertwined, and I need to find a balance. Finally, the ‘message’ should be sincere and impactful, not just empty words. I’ll jot down these key points first.
summarized_info: Recorded initial thoughts on the speech content on a park bench, mentioning keywords such as starting point, turning point, ascent, low point, and final message.

title: Alma Mater Speech Outline v0.1
content:
I'll use this notebook I just bought from the bookstore to make a start.  
1. Starting Point: The Decisive Choice and the Library Window.  
2. Turning Point: The Late-Night Call and the Shift in Path.  
3. The Climb: Challenges, Strategies, and Perseverance Along the Way.  
4. The Low Point and Its Gift: Lessons Learned from the Toughest Times.  
5. Final Words: Sincere Hopes and Advice.  

I spoke with Director Wang on the phone tonight and confirmed the timing and basic framework. Jiaxin gave me a lot of encouragement while shopping this afternoon, saying my experiences would surely resonate with the younger students. Alright, now it's time to fill each section with stories and details.
summarized_info: Created a draft speech outline consisting of five sections (Starting Point, Turning Point, Climbing, Troughs and Gifts, and Message), mentioning a phone call with Director Wang in the evening and receiving encouragement from my best friend Jiaxin in the afternoon.

title: Reflections After a Phone Call with My Younger Brother
content: On the evening of April 26, 2025, I had a video call with Xiaofeng for over an hour. I finally poured out all the exhaustion and stress I’ve been feeling lately. I especially mentioned how anxious I’ve been about Zixuan’s studies this semester. A few days ago, when I checked his homework, his math calculations were a complete mess, and his English was full of grammar and vocabulary mistakes. I’ve been neglecting him too much lately. After listening, Xiaofeng calmly helped me analyze the situation and even proposed a solution I had never considered—hiring a professional caregiver. He said this would free me up to spend more time with Zixuan. His words were like a beam of light, shining into the chaos of my life. I need to seriously consider this suggestion.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei recorded her thoughts after a video call with her younger brother, mentioning that she confided in him about her son Zhang Zixuan's recent academic decline (with many errors in math calculations and English grammar and vocabulary). She also noted her brother's suggestion to hire a caregiver.

title: Final decision and lecture preparation approach
content: October 13 Review: In the end, I accepted the invitation to give a lecture at the community center. Yesterday, I had a long conversation with my mom, and her understanding and support were the most important reassurance. One of her remarks deeply moved me: "Your experiences might light up someone else's path in the dark." Jiaxin also analyzed the positive impact from the perspective of a professional social worker and gave me some practical public speaking tips. After considering everyone's opinions, I decided to stop hesitating and accept this opportunity to share.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei reflected on the decision-making process of accepting the invitation to give a community lecture, mentioning her mother's support and inspiration, as well as the practical advice provided by her close friend from a professional perspective.

title: Minutes of Family Financial Meeting
content:
Core Resolution: Replanning Family Savings and Travel Budget.  
1. Adjustment to Long-Term Travel Plans: In light of the current family financial situation and the mother's health condition, it is unanimously agreed to postpone the originally planned in-depth trip to Japan within five years.  
2. New Travel Direction: Shift towards more cost-controllable and meaningful short-term root-seeking trips in the Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area.  
3. New Savings Allocation Plan: Future family savings will be allocated according to the following proportions—40% for medical reserves, 30% for children's education, and 30% for daily and flexible expenses.  
Core Principle: Prioritize medical security and essential savings.
summarized_info: Yu Xiaowei documented the key resolutions from the family financial meeting, including postponing the trip to Japan, shifting travel plans to the Greater Bay Area, and the allocation ratios for savings in medical, education, and daily expenses (40%/30%/30%).

title: Lecture Review and Reflection
content: On July 31, 2025, a sharing session on family security planning was successfully completed at the Kai Tak Community Hall. Although the preparation process was quite intense, the on-site response was positive, with active audience interaction. This was a new attempt for me and also my first public lecture as an individual on the topic of "Family Financial Security," from which I gained a lot. Moving forward, I can summarize the experience and explore opportunities to conduct a similar session in other communities.
summarized_info: I have recorded my reflections on the review of the lecture held on July 31st, noting that it was the first time such a themed lecture had been organized.

title: Review of National Day Gathering
content:
The gathering on National Day in 2025 was a great success.  
Attendees: me, Weiming, Xuanxuan, Xinxin; my younger brother Xiaofeng, his wife Li Ting, their son (nephew), and daughter (niece); my father Yu Guoqiang and mother Chen Meiling.  
Everyone arrived on time, and the house was especially lively. The gifts prepared for my nephew and niece were well-received. Mom prepared a big feast. I hope we can gather more often in the future.
summarized_info: I have documented a review of the family gathering during the National Day, listing all the participating family members.
